basic.floral_language:
Fittonia verschaffeltii
Floriography: delicate, refreshing, vitality.
A small evergreen plant, leaves of the nerve plant are oval with white or red veins intercrossing like a web. Widely used indoor and micro-landscape for decoration.
The plant requires partial shade habitat. Two to three hours sunbath in winter is acceptable. Yellow flowers may bloom in September to November if growing well.

maintenance.soil: Likes moist and breathable soil, best planted in sphagnum moss
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries, rub the leaves with water to keep moisture
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
